PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Charles Hayes, 3312 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 18, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think that refuse drivers and collectors should be tipped at Christmas time? Is service affected if they are not?" answer reads: "Yes, because they take care of a man's place and keep his lawn straightened up so therefore they should be tipped.  However, I don't think that it affects the service because the refuse collectors are getting paid, anyhow."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Charles Hayes wearing eyeglasses, plaid shirt, and striped jacket, standing in interior, possibly barbershop with wainscoting and poster that reads "Hair Cut Styles... Shop Hours... Open...Close..."
